channel.title: Timer help
channel.description:
ok i need help with my timers.. like ppl in combat can attack really fast.. massing i guess, and i want to slow it down to more of a real rs speed so ppl can't do that
ive been told to search for [code]actiontimer = o[/code] but there is sooo many. and the ones i have changed make no difference in the speed that someone attacks, so can someone plz tell me what timer(s) to change? and to a more realistic number, as i said closer to a rs speed?

item.title: Timer help
item.dc:creator: @butnugget butnugget
item.description:
@butnugget wrote:

ok i searched for that… and it don’t seem to matter any which way i change these numbers on all 3… nothing seems to change you can still mass really bad…

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == (4151)) // whip { PkingDelay = 30; wepdelay = 30; resetanim = 30; }

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == (4151)) // whip { PkingDelay = 13; wepdelay = 13; resetanim = 13; }

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == (4151)) // whip { PkingDelay = 5; wepdelay = 5; resetanim = 5; }
all 3 of these are in my client.java

Read full topic

item.title: Timer help
item.dc:creator: @durent durent
item.description:
@durent wrote:

Your looking for something to start with a wepon, which would mean your action timer is not only working, but its working for a specific item so your gona look for something like.

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == (4151)) // whip

under that command you would put your timer, then just end it with
a “}” so its gona look like

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == (4151)) // whip { PkingDelay = 4; actionTimer = 4; }

Read full topic
